name: Lich Hound
movement: walking speed of 50 feet and flying speed of 30 feet
description: The Lich Hound is a medium-sized undead creature embodying the essence of fear and death, with a menacing aura and formidable presence.
memorable: Its ability to instill fear and track living creatures make it a terrifying predator on the battlefield.
goals: To hunt down living creatures and spread terror among its enemies.
relations: It might be allied with other undead creatures or serve a powerful lich.
environment: Commonly found in graveyards, ruins, or areas infused with necrotic energy.
strengths: High Dexterity and Constitution scores enhance its agility and endurance in combat.
weaknesses: Very low Intelligence, which may limit its tactical options in certain scenarios.
attacks: Uses a Multiattack to unleash an Eerie Howl followed by vicious Bite attacks, which can knock foes prone.
most_powerful_ability: The Eerie Howl can frighten multiple creatures, significantly disrupting their actions.
senses: Has blindsight up to 60 feet, enhancing its ability to detect hidden prey.
skills: Excels in Acrobatics and has a good Perception score, making it difficult to sneak past.
additional_information: Immune to poison and exhausted conditions.
Resistant to slashing and piercing damage from nonmagical sources.
Does not require air, food, drink, or sleep due to its undead nature.
Can pinpoint the location of living creatures using Blood Sense.
Can shift between the Material Plane and the Ethereal Plane.
test_queries: undead monster that tracks living beings
creature that frightens with eerie howls
swift predator of the undead variety
monster that can shift to the ethereal plane
fast hound that embodies fear and death
